Game don't work. stop responding after launching

Game controller (at least for xbox360 controller) can be enabled by downloading "x360ce", google it.  Then place the x360ce exe into the dead rising 2 game folder. double click this exe and go to Options then under Hook Mode select Compatibility mode.

xbox360 controller should work now for the game. the exe doesnt need to be turned on as it will automatically work with game after the initial setup.

hope this helps.

For all the people having a issue with saving the game make sure that you run the .exe as an administrator.

.exe is located in C:\Program Files (x86)\Capcom\Dead Rising 2 Off The Record

On the issue of the cut scenes not playing for me if I run the .exe through steam it doesn't play them, so just launch it from the desktop or the path above.

Uhh, I have no idea how to fix that. I changed my user name and stuff and it still messes up.. Help plz?

As mentioned in my earlier posting - just changing your username wont help since the folder name (USER/Appdata/...) is still the same.

Create a NEW User for your windows installation, does not have to be administrator by the way.

To save without using an existing windows live account: Click "create account", click "offline account", click "accept"

You're good to go ;D

Now, maybe I'm the only one with this issue, but I can't find any options or configuration settings in my game, and I'd really enjoy turning up the graphics on this. Anyone else?

Graphical settings are hard to get to. I did it this way, launch the game, load a save/start new game, then press [esc] to open the menu and you should find something like "PC settings" (or configuration) in this menu.

Runs perfectly on my machine except for the memory lags here & there. No sound-related problems either, but I have a Realtek card if that means anything.

As far as the game's storyline goes though, I was kinda pissed that they reworked Chuck Greene's story path to replace it with Frank West instead of giving Frank his very own, and so its almost like Chuck doesn't exist. I did like Chuck Greene better though, and I liked Frank West better in the first game without the cocky & show-off attitude. Same good gameplay though, and cool Sandbox mode.
